text: JEANNE MOOS: Hail to the chief?
Hail to the chief's wife.
DONALD TRUMP: Melania.

JEANNE MOOS: She's doing better
than the chief in the polls.
Of course, she's less visible.

Though she hosted an
International Women's Day

luncheon, the White
House wouldn't let
the press stay for her speech.
- Right this way, guys.
MELANIA TRUMP: Thank you.
- Thank you

MELANIA TRUMP:
Your excellencies,
esteemed representatives.

JEANNE MOOS: Melania Trump
is now held in high esteem

by 52% of those
polled by CNN/ORC.

That's compared to only 36%
before the inauguration.

Tweeted one fan,
"She has given class,

elegance, and a reverence for
God back to this country."

Grumbled a critic, "Easy
to have a great approval

rating when no one ever sees
you or hears you speak."

MELANIA TRUMP: Our
father who art in heaven.

JEANNE MOOS: Though we've heard
her pray and read Dr. Seuss
to kids at a New York hospital.

MELANIA TRUMP: Your
head full of brains
and your shoes full of feet.

JEANNE MOOS: We hear a lot about
shoes full of Melania's feet.

As a former model, she's
under a fashion microscope.
"Oh, No She Didn't--

Melania Trump Wears One
Dress Two Days in a Row."

Even her body language
with her husband

is microanalyzed, leading to
calls to "Free Melania," "Blink

twice if you want
us to save you."

TREVOR NOAH: You
know who I always
look at for like the truth.

Not Melania, but I
look at her eyes.

Look at her eyes, and
you can see, in her eyes,

she's like, you guys don't
know what he's capable of.

JEANNE MOOS: Comedians take
their shots or do cartoonists--

"I will now be the first lady,
instead of the third wife"--

but her approval still
jumped 16 points.

Turns out men favor her
more than women, 58% to 46%.
Tweeted one guy, "This just in--

old white Republican dudes
approve of ex-model wives."

But Melania's climbing
in the polls her way.
Jeanne Moos, CNN, New York.
